name: localrag
displayName: LocalRAG - Enhanced Local RAG for VS Code
description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation extension for VSCode with local sentence transformers and semantic chunking

localrag.defaultEmbeddingModel.markdownDescription: **Default embedding model**: The embedding model to use when initializing the extension. You can specify a curated model name (e.g., `Xenova/all-MiniLM-L6-v2`) or a local model path. Click on models in the tree view to switch models at runtime.

localrag.localModelPath.markdownDescription: Absolute path to a folder containing a locally downloaded Transformers.js-compatible embedding model. Models in this folder appear in the tree view and can be selected directly.

localrag.embeddingDbPath.markdownDescription: **Embedding DB path**: Leave empty to use the default storage location. If set to a relative path, it will be resolved from the workspace root (project path).

localrag.topK.description: Number of top results to return from RAG queries

localrag.chunkSize.description: Maximum size of text chunks for embedding (in characters)

localrag.logLevel.description: Logging verbosity level for the LocalRAG output channel
enumDescriptions: Debug: Verbose logging for troubleshooting (most detailed)

localrag.retrievalStrategy.markdownDescription:
**Retrieval strategy** for RAG queries (applies to both simple and agentic modes):

- **hybrid** (recommended): 70% semantic + 30% keyword
- **vector**: Pure semantic similarity
- **ensemble**: Advanced RRF fusion of vector + BM25 (slower, more accurate)
- **bm25**: Pure keyword search with BM25 (no embeddings, fast exact matching)

üí° _Can be overridden per query via LM tool parameter_
enumDescriptions: Pure semantic search using embeddings only
Ensemble: Uses Reciprocal Rank Fusion with BM25 (most accurate, higher memory)
BM25: Pure keyword search (Okapi BM25 algorithm, no embeddings needed)

localrag.useAgenticMode.markdownDescription:
**Enable Agentic RAG:** Multi-step retrieval with query planning, iterative refinement, and result evaluation. When disabled, uses simple single-shot retrieval.

üìö [Learn more about Agentic RAG](https://github.com/borgius/localrag#agentic-rag)

localrag.agenticMaxIterations.markdownDescription:
Maximum retrieval iterations in agentic mode. Higher = more thorough but slower.

‚ö†Ô∏è _Only applies when Agentic Mode is enabled_

localrag.agenticConfidenceThreshold.markdownDescription:
Confidence threshold (0-1) to stop retrieval. Lower = more iterations, higher = stops earlier.

‚ö†Ô∏è _Only applies when Agentic Mode is enabled_

localrag.agenticIterativeRefinement.markdownDescription:
Generate follow-up queries to fill information gaps detected during retrieval.

‚ö†Ô∏è _Only applies when Agentic Mode is enabled_

localrag.agenticUseLLM.markdownDescription:
**Use LLM (Copilot) for intelligent planning:** Uses Copilot for query decomposition and result evaluation instead of rule-based heuristics.

**Requirements:**
- ‚úÖ GitHub Copilot subscription
- ‚úÖ GitHub Copilot extension

**Trade-offs:**
- ‚úÖ Much more intelligent
- ‚úÖ Context-aware planning
- ‚ö†Ô∏è 2-3x slower
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Uses Copilot API quota

‚ö†Ô∏è _Only applies when Agentic Mode is enabled_

localrag.agenticLLMModel.markdownDescription:
**LLM model to use** for query planning and evaluation. Models shown include all Copilot Free (0x) and Paid (1x) options, plus any premium multipliers where applicable. Availability depends on your Copilot plan and enabled model providers.

**Legend:**
- **0x** = no premium requests (Copilot Free)
- **1x** = premium requests (Copilot paid)

‚ö†Ô∏è _Only applies when LLM Mode is enabled_
enumDescriptions: Grok Code Fast 1: Fast coding model, 0.25x

localrag.agenticIncludeWorkspaceContext.markdownDescription:
**Include workspace context:** Pass selected code, active file, imports, and symbols to Copilot (like #codebase).

**Includes:**
- Selected code (max 1000 chars)
- File imports and symbols
- Workspace name

**Privacy:** Only relative paths, no sensitive data

‚ö†Ô∏è _Only applies when LLM Mode is enabled_

localrag.includeExtensions.markdownDescription: **File extensions to include** when scanning directories for documents. Only files with these extensions will be processed. Leave empty to include all supported extensions.

localrag.watchFolders.markdownDescription: **Folders to watch for changes**: List of folder paths (absolute or workspace-relative) that will be monitored. When files are added, modified, or deleted in these folders, the default topic is automatically updated. Leave empty to disable folder watching.

localrag.watchOnChanges.markdownDescription: **Enable automatic watching**: When enabled, the extension will automatically watch configured folders for changes and update the default topic. You can toggle this setting using the pause/resume button in the topic tree view.

localrag.commonDatabasePath.markdownDescription:
**Path to a shared/common RAG database folder.** Topics from this path are read-only and cannot be deleted or modified. Useful for team-shared knowledge bases.

**Format:** Absolute path to a folder containing exported RAG database files.

languageModelTools.name: ragQuery
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Use this tool when the user asks questions about topics they have added to the RAG system. Supports both simple single-shot retrieval and advanced agentic RAG with multi-step query planning, iterative refinement, and intelligent result evaluation. The tool intelligently matches the requested topic: it first tries an exact match, then finds the most semantically similar topic if no exact match exists. In agentic mode, complex queries are automatically decomposed into sub-queries for comprehensive information gathering. Always check the 'topicMatched' field and 'agenticMetadata' in the response.

topic.description: The name of the topic to search within (e.g., 'React Documentation', 'Company Policy'). If exact match is not found, the most semantically similar topic will be automatically selected.

query.description: The search query or question to find relevant information

topK.description: Number of top results to return (optional, uses configured value if not provided)

retrievalStrategy.description: Retrieval strategy: 'vector' (semantic only), 'hybrid' (semantic + keyword), 'ensemble' (RRF fusion), or 'bm25' (keyword only). Optional - uses configured value if not provided.

useAgenticMode.description: Enable agentic RAG with multi-step query planning and iterative retrieval (optional, defaults to extension settings). Note: All agentic configuration (iterations, confidence, etc.) is controlled via VS Code settings and cannot be overridden per query.
